column2: In an increasingly centralized world where the main infrastructure providers (aws, google cloud) also owns the main forms of distribution (search, YouTube, twitch) conflicts of interest are going to arise. Services giving users a say via crypto governance is a potential solution. https://t.co/XcEzWckTuO

The true price of having a handful of companies control your entire digital life and infrastructure only becomes obvious when a war, a hack, politics, a policy change, mistake or natural disaster cuts you off. By the end of the 2020s more people will appreciate this fact.

@AnettRolikova Good advise. Here is a tool which helps with this. I've decided to delete all my tweets over a year old and have them auto delete after 12 months going forward. I do this because I prefer my social media presence to be ephemeral.

https://t.co/Cr48DrUGoZ

I believe the notion of a corporate sanctioned and social media enforced authentic self is incredibly boring in an age where it's so easy to assume different personas. I instead would urge people to maintain a private life outside of work and purge all social media regularly.

One thing I never liked about working at Facebook was the notion that I was meant to bring my ‚Äúauthentic‚Äù self to work. This felt coercive in a similar way to my experiences going to a Catholic school in üáÆüá™. A demand not only on my time but also my soul.
